sub_title: Guiding our Solutions Engineers to solve problems for SkySpecs' European SaaS customers, users of our wind power asset management software suite
summary:
A Canadian-born traveller, I've worked in energy since 2010, in Wind since 2014 and blade-related O&M since 2016. I've worked both in large business and helped scale small start-ups (having established a European office for one of them) and am familiar with the strengths and weaknesses of each. My latest passion has been supporting our renewable SaaS clients with technical customizations and solutions to fill product gap.

I've lived in 6 different countries and excel at international and cross-culture business interaction and communication in the wind industry. I value transparency, responsibility, and am against blame culture - Let's fail fast, learn, and move on.

school.name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU)

profile_positions.description:
• Guiding the Europe-based SkySpecs Solutions Engineers (3 direct reports) to supercharge their professional growth, streamline their project execution path, and to ultimately better serve our customers.
• As part of the Solutions leadership team, interviewed and hired 4 FTEs and set department strategy for rapid growth and a pivot into more tech-enabled service offerings for our clients
• To ensure I can stay sharp in the needs of my team, I perform Solutions engineering project work and participate in our stand-ups as a project team member
• Transitioned the Solutions Engineering team to be more product focused, supporting the Product Management organization
• Responsible for a few key product areas including Weather and Lightning workflows, AEP products (with external partners), and threshold-based decision making products.
profile_positions.title: Associate Director of Solutions Engineering

profile_positions.description:
• Lead Solutions Engineer for projects that included data clean-up; improvement of customer data structures and management; and blade engineering & analysis
• Retained close relations to our clients to properly evaluate their technical requirements
• Leveraged SQL, Python and our internal GraphQL API for scripting and automation and data analysis
profile_positions.title: Sr. Solutions Engineer

profile_positions.description: • Lead account manager for 3 of our largest European SaaS customers, overseeing their software experience and integration and spearheading any customization work needed
profile_positions.title: Sr. Solutions Manager - Europe

profile_positions.description:
SkySpecs is an automated diagnostics and maintenance provider serving both the on- and offshore wind industry with a high-speed, accurate and repeatable UAV-based blade inspection solution.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I am responsible for SkySpecs BV - the European subsidiary of SkySpecs Inc. based in Amsterdam - and will manage all sales, account management and operational support for European customers and projects.

Ask me about:
• UAV and robotics technology in the wind industry
• Wind turbine blade inspections and their value to wind farm owners, operators and OEMs
• Why our customers choose an automated inspection solution like SkySpecs
profile_positions.title: Sales and Account Manager for Europe

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the improvement of Siemens Wind Power service O&M performance through automation research and development. This is done by focusing on service industry trends such as automation systems (including blade repair robotics and drone inspections) and smart wearables and communication.

This role includes:
- Identifying new disruptive automation technologies, primary in the area of WTG blade maintenance
- Driving the execution of different R&D projects, with total budgets over €2 million
- Creating and maintaining relationships with our current and future research partners, start-ups, and specialty suppliers, to foster new research projects and products
profile_positions.title: R&D Automation Engineer

profile_positions.description:
The Siemens Graduate Programme (SGP) is comprised of a 2-year work experience in Siemens comprised of 3 varied and challenging projects in different departments. Two week-long leadership training modules are also part of the programme, focusing on self-awareness and -reflection, coaching, and running different management scenarios.

Rotation 3 (Jan 2016 – Sept 2016): Junior Installation Project Manager for the Gode Wind Project installation & commissioning phase (Vejle, DK)

- Assisting the Installation PM and Sr. PM of Gode Wind 1+2 (comprising of 97 6MW Siemens Wind Turbines) in a variety of tasks including resource planning, vessel demobilisation, commissioning tracking, and client management
- Fully responsible for the development, procurement and testing of an offshore prototype tool designed to reduce WTG foundation oscillations experienced during installation
- Coordinating the handover of Gode Wind 1&2 to our service organisation

Rotation 2 (June 2015 – Dec 2015): Graduate Technical Project Manager in Service Wind Power operations (Newcastle, UK)

- Managed the project planning, execution and close-out of a WTG rotor rebalance campaign for 4 different customers at 7 different sites
- Reported project status to upper management and was responsible for a 4-person team
- Setup a variety of other projects by preparing the pre-planning and investigating technical and logistical feasibility

Rotation 1 (Oct 2014 – May 2015): Graduate Service Engineer in Service Wind Power

- Investigated post-production WTG faults, and collaborated with failure analysis and design departments to develop, test and release engineering solutions
profile_positions.title: Siemens Graduate Program (SGP)

profile_positions.description:
- Collaborated with a team of 20 international students to develop an economic subsea oil and gas processing facility while upholding DNV’s values of safeguarding life, property and the environment
- Personally responsible for contributing mechanical, environmental and heat transfer knowledge
- Interviewed and networked with dozens of experts in the offshore and subsea industry
- Final result was a 400+ page internal technical document and a professional-grade brochure
- Presented the final technical presentation to 500+ industry professionals including DNV’s top management and CEO
- Showcased in media such as the Industri & Olji Norwegian newspaper and the Teknisk Ukeblad magazine which reaches 276,000 readers
- Chosen to represent DNV GL at ONS Norway and present outcomes of the Summer Project 2013
profile_positions.title: Summer Project 2013 Employee

profile_positions.description:
- Undertaking engineering analysis, including modelling and energy analysis using EE4, DOE 2.1E and eQuest, reviewing energy simulations done by others, data interpretation, data presentation and design and site supervision on ground source projects
- Undertaking technology and market research and analysis for clients and creating research documents, papers and presentations
- Providing project support activities to the Principals and other staff
- Performing site audits of mechanical systems for research and modelling projects alike
profile_positions.title: Associate Research Scientist

profile_positions.description:
- Managed quality assurance test schedules for the Blackberry Curve 8500 handheld and accessory platforms 
- Collaborated with Design, Manufacturing, Reliability and Supply Chain departments to develop a more efficient accessory test tracking system 
- Reviewed mechanical issues, such as structure integrity and component durability, and mitigated them in collaboration the with the mechanical design team 
- Presented project progress, milestones and design issues to company executives
profile_positions.title: Hardware Quality Project Manager

company.name: Board of European Students of Technology

volunteer_experiences.description: As a BEST member, tasks include event organization and promotion, teamwork and collaboration, and international communication with both other schools and companies. We organise yearly local engineering competitions, academic courses for students visiting from other universities, and contributed to multi-university events encouraging development, training and company exposure to students.

company.name: Board of European Students of Technology

volunteer_experiences.description:
As President of the local charter of BEST, I led a board of six members and directed and facilitated the entire organisation of 40 volunteers. We organised and managed NTNU engineering competitions, international technical courses, and training seminars. I also played a part in negotiating and forming  partnerships with NTNU, NGOs and companies. That year, we managed two major events totalling in 115 000 NOK budgets and I started leading the planning for four more throughout the remainder of the presidential mandate.

As President, I was also responsible for representing BEST Trondheim on the international stage to 32 other European countries.

company.name: The University of Toronto Engineering Society

volunteer_experiences.description:
SUDS is the local event space and pub that is run by the University of Toronto Engineering Society as a social area for the students to meet, share ideas and unwind after a hard week.

I (along with a co-manager) managed a licensed student pub that reached $46 000 in annual sales  
We directed a staff of 20 servers to ensure customer satisfaction and that the Pub met its legal and financial obligation. During our year, we saw an increased participation of organized promotions and events, yielding sales and profit increases by 43% and 72% respectively over the prior year’s numbers
